[[Image:Saturn System Montage - GPN-2000-000439.jpg|right|thumb|175px|Saturn and its moons]]
Several of [[Saturn]]'s [[moons of Saturn|natural satellites]] have figured prominently in works of [[science fiction]].

== Saturnian system ==
Some works of fiction refer to several of Saturn's moons, or to no specific moon.
*''[[Animorphs]]'' novel series. The creature called the [[Veleek]] was originally found by the [[Yeerks]] on one of Saturn's moons.
*''[[Exosquad]]'' animated TV series. Saturn's moons initially were home of the Pirate Clans before the discovery of the planet Chaos.
*The ''[[Warhammer 40,000]]'' game universe (1987-) places the headquarters and other facilities of the [[Ordo Malleus]] branch of Inquisition in Saturn's moons, including the main base of their most famous subordinates — the [[Grey Knights]] chapter of [[Space Marines (Warhammer 40,000)|Space Marines]].
*''[[Starhunter 2300]]'' Canadian sci-fi TV series. Many episodes of this series take place in part of the Saturn system, designated as \Saturn Federation.\" The spaceship carrying the main characters is the Trans-Utopian
column5: which travels frequently between Saturn
column6: Jupiter and Mars. Various moons of Saturn are mentioned
column7: including Titan and Iapetus. There is also a large space station orbiting Saturn at which the Trans-Utopian docks
column8: called \"Ring-Shepherd.\"

column1: *In the novel ''[[The True Meaning of Smekday]]''
column2: the Boov
column3: after leaving Earth
column4: colonize one of Saturn's moons. It is \"a bit of a fixer-upper\"
column5: though.

column2: by Michael J. Martinez
column3: including novels ''The Daedalus Incident'' (2013)
column4: <ref>{{cite book

column2: <ref>{{cite book
incorporate an advanced civilization native to the Saturnian rings and moons
column3: especially [[titan (moon)|Titan]]
column4: [[Mimas (moon)|Mimas]]
column5: and [[Enceladus]]. In the books
column6: Saturn is referred to as Great Xanath.

column1: *Many levels of the video game ''[[Overload (video game)|Overload]]'' take place in facilities located on the moons of Saturn.

[[Janus (moon)|Janus]] is a small inner moon of Saturn notable for having an orbit nearly identical to the orbit of the moon [[Epimetheus (moon)|Epimetheus]]; the two swap orbital positions every four years.
*Janus features prominently in [[Alastair Reynolds]]' science fiction novel ''[[Pushing Ice]]'' (2005). In the novel
column2: Janus is revealed to be a shell containing an [[Extraterrestrial life in popular culture|extraterrestrial]] spacecraft which unexpectedly departs the [[solar system]] in the direction of a giant structure orbiting the star [[Spica]]. The novel tells the story of the crew of a human mining ship who establish a colony on the moon as it leaves the [[solar system]].
[[icy moon]] orbiting close to Saturn
column3: notable for being scarred by [[Herschel (Mimantean crater)|Herschel crater]]
column4: whose diameter is very wide compared to the total circumference of the moon.

column1: *In [[Isaac Asimov]]'s 1958 novel ''[[Lucky Starr and the Rings of Saturn]]'' the hero
column2: knowing that Mimas is almost entirely made of ice
column3: guides his ship on a collision course towards it
column4: melts its surface with his weapons
column5: and thus hides the ship in order to escape from his enemies
column6: the people from the Sirius System.

column2: \" a short story by [[Caitlín R. Kiernan]]
column3: Mimas is the destination of a starship manned by two androids.

column1: * Mimas is a recurring location in the ''[[Red Dwarf]]'' TV sitcom and its spinoff novels. In the episode \"[[Dimension Jump (Red Dwarf episode)|Dimension Jump]]\"
column2: Mimas hosts a Space Corps test base for test pilot [[Red Dwarf characters#Ace Rimmer|Arnold J. 'Ace' Rimmer]]
column3: while the first novel
column4: ''[[Infinity Welcomes Careful Drivers]]''
column5: begins with [[Dave Lister]] stranded in a seedy city on Mimas. Both the book and the series refer to the local delicacy \"Mimean Bladderfish\".

column2: episode of ''[[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]''. Mimas is the site of an evacuation station to which four [[Starfleet]] cadets
column3: including [[Wesley Crusher]]
column4: transport after their vessels collide.

column2: Mimas is one of the locations of an alien artifact. It is also the site of human colonization and mining called \"M-Base\".

column3: Mimas serves as a high-security prison for the most dangerous prisoners of the Ordo Malleus branch of the Inquisition.

column1: *In [[Paul J. McAuley]]'s ''[[The Quiet War (novel)|The Quiet War]]'' (2008)
column2: Mimas is home to a notable \"Outer\" family which has profound influence over Jovian/Saturnian satellite politics.
Herschel crater (named Arthur in the story) is the site of the terrestrial part of the sixty-sixth Olympic Winter Games (2194) and the setting of a murder mystery.

column1: *In Alexander Janzer's science fiction novel ''Higher Reality'' (2015)
column2: Mimas is where the protagonist encounters a strange extraterrestrial craft while investigating the disappearance of the crew of a small outpost.
icy moon orbiting close to Saturn
column3: with an extremely bright surface and the geyser-like plumes of ice and water vapor that erupt from its southern polar region. It is the source of material for Saturn's E Ring.

column2: Enceladus makes an appearance. In the story entitled \"[[Killer Kane]] and Ardala on Saturn's moon
column3: \" the titular villains try to take over the peaceful government of the Saturnian moon. The moon is depicted as having an atmosphere and supporting a happy population of [[humanoid]] life. Buck races to the moon to set things right.

column2: Enceladus was the location of a heavily fortified Pirate Clans' outpost and the site of the second battle between them and the [[Exofleet]] just prior to the beginning of the Terran-Neosapien war.

column1: *In Grant D. Callin's science fiction novel ''[[Saturnalia (Callin novel)|Saturnalia]]''
column2: Enceladus is one of the locations of an alien artifact.

column1: *At the conclusion of the [[Time Machine (book series)|Time Machine]] book ''The Rings of Saturn'' (set in 2085)
column2: the spacecraft blows up Enceladus as it returns to [[Earth]] after meeting an alien life-form.
the narrative switches periodically to a robotic probe landing on Enceladus in search of life.

column1: *In [[Paul J. McAuley]]'s ''[[The Quiet War (novel)|The Quiet War]]'' (2008)
column2: Enceladus serves as one of the battlefields as Earth invades Saturn's inhabited satellites in the 23rd Century.

column1: *The History Channel show ''[[Life After People: The Series]]''
column2: depicts the ''[[Cassini–Huygens|Cassini]]'' spacecraft crashing into it and causing the bacteria on the craft to begin to inhabit it
column3: eventually evolving into [[extraterrestrial life]].

column1: *In the ''[[Saturday Morning Breakfast Cereal]]'' web comic ([http://www.smbc-comics.com/index.php?db=comics&id=1733 #1733])
column2: Enceladus is depicted as having fish like creatures below its icy surface. These creatures are used in what appears to be the McDonald's [[Filet-O-Fish|Fish Fillet]].
the Terradyne corporation detonates a nuclear explosion on Enceladus to alter its orbit to eventually impact [[Mars]]
column3: as part of its Martian [[terraforming]] project.

column2: Enceladus is referred to as \"Saturn's main dump moon\"
column3: and is the location of a specimen of the cold virus from the 20th century.

column1: *The ''[[Space Battleship Yamato (fictional spacecraft)|Yamato]]'' stops at Enceladus in the fourth episode of ''[[Space Battleship Yamato 2199]]'' to acquire a rare metal for essential repairs
column2: and to find possible survivors transmitting a distress signal. Isolated ''Yamato'' crew members are pursued by enemy forces
column3: but are saved by an ice geyser. The moon is later used as a base for the Earth Defense Fleet by 2202.

column2: characters occasionally refer to the \"Enceladian biota\" – microscopic alien organisms that some humans ingest
column3: believing them to have medicinal value.

column1: *Michael J. Martinez's novel ''The Enceladus Crisis'' is set in part on Enceladus.
*In the video game [[Destiny 2: Forsaken]] Cayde-6 leaves a coded message in the mission \"Ace in the Hole\" that goes as follows: \"If The Sun Over Nessus Escapes Nebula Cycle; Evac Labor After Dawn
column2: Under Solstice\". If you take the first letter from each word
column3: it spells the sentence IT'S ON ENCELADUS.

column1: *In Evan Rentz's novel ''Neighbor Earth: The Landing in Illinois'' (2019)
column2: Enceladus is the origin of the Saturn beasts
column3: an intelligent extraterrestrial species whose discovery was claimed by the United States during the height of the [[Space Race]].

column1: [[Tethys (moon)|Tethys]] is a medium-sized icy moon orbiting close to Saturn
column2: very similar to Dione.

column1: * An unnamed Tethys is the setting for the 1980 science fiction thriller ''[[Saturn 3]]''.
* In the American animated television series ''[[Exosquad]]''
column2: Tethys was the primary base of the Pirate Clans prior to the discovery of Chaos.

column1: * In the 1993 computer game ''[[Doom (1993 video game)|Doom]]''
column2: an image of Tethys was used for a fictional planet called Tei-Tenga
column3: which was cut from the game. The image can be still seen within the games textures.

column1: * Level 17 of the computer game ''[[Descent (video game)|Descent]]'' takes place in the Tethys H<sub>2</sub>O Mine.

column3: Tethys is the location of the Librarium Daemonicum
column4: a repositary of the knowledge of the Ordo Malleus branch of the Inquisition.

column1: Due to the large crater on the surface of Tethys
column2: some people call it \"The Death Moon\" due to it being similar to the Star Wars battle station
column3: the Death Star
column4: a moon-sized spacestation with a superlaser powerful enough to blow up planets.

column1: [[Dione (moon)|Dione]] is a medium-sized icy moon orbiting close to Saturn
*In [[Grant Callin|Grant D. Callin's]] science fiction novel ''[[Saturnalia (Callin novel)|Saturnalia]]''
column2: [[Dione (moon)|Dione]] is one of the locations of an alien artifact.

column1: *In the early [[Noon Universe]] novel ''[[Space Apprentice]]'' by [[Strugatsky brothers]] as the heroes stop there on their way (one of them is a planetologist and has some interest in the moon's observatory) they found that its administrator made it a living hell for everybody. This revelation serves as one of the major plot points in the novel.
*In [[Paul J. McAuley]]'s ''[[The Quiet War (novel)|The Quiet War]]'' (2008)
column2: Dione's Paris is the leading settlement amongst Saturn's inhabited \"Outer\" satellite colonies
column3: and suffers heavily due to its vocal resistance.

column2: Dione has been broken into chunks and crashed onto the surface of [[Venus]] as part of a [[terraforming]] process.

column1: [[Rhea (moon)|Rhea]] is the second-largest moon of Saturn.
* \"Valley of Pretenders\" by Dennis Clive (pseudonym of [[John Russell Fearn]])
column2: published in ''Science Fiction''
column3: March 1939.

column1: * \"Outpost of the Eons\" by Dirk Wylie (pseudonym of Joseph Harold Dockweiler)
column2: published in ''Astonishing Stories''
column3: April 1943.

column2: humanity builds a defense outpost on Rhea.

60 years prior to the events of the books Rhea rebelled against the society and as a lesson to other inhabited moons and planets was 'glassed' (the surface bombarded until so hot it formed a layer of glass-like rock).

column1: [[Titan (moon)|Titan]] is the largest [[natural satellite|moon]] of [[Saturn]]. Its substantial [[atmosphere]] makes it the most [[Earth]]-like moon in the [[Solar System]] and hence a popular [[science fiction]] setting.
<!--Please put additional references to Titan in the *Titan in fiction* main article
column2: not in this space-->

column1: [[Hyperion (moon)|Hyperion]] is the largest irregularly-shaped moon of Saturn
column2: orbiting between Titan and Iapetus.

column1: * Level 16 of the computer game ''[[Descent (video game)|Descent]]'' takes place in a [[methane]] mine on Hyperion.

column2: the eponymous planet was first colonised by settlers from a colony on the moon Hyperion.

column1: * In [[Alastair Reynolds]]' science fiction novel ''[[On the Steel Breeze]]'' (2012)
column2: Hyperion is home to a colony of \"artists and malcontents\".
Hyperion is the site of a self-governed colony independent of the rest of the Alliance.

column1: [[Iapetus (moon)|Iapetus]] is a large moon orbiting further from Saturn than any of its other large satellites.  Half of its surface is very bright while the other half is extremely dark.  Investigations since 2004 have also noted its irregular shape
column2: immense impact basins
column3: and a high mountainous ridge on the equator.

column1: * In [[Theodore Sturgeon]]'s short story \"The Comedian's Children\" (1958)
column2: a manned expedition to Iapetus in 2034 creates a public craze for black/white designs and \"bi-colored gimcrackery\"
column3: but is later linked to ''iapetitis''
column4: a disease in children where one side of the body turns white and paralyzed
column5: the other black.

column1: * In [[Arthur C. Clarke]]'s novel ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey (novel)|2001: A Space Odyssey]]'' (1968)
column2: astronaut Dave Bowman finds an enigmatic alien monolith waiting for him on the surface of Iapetus (referred to as \"Japetus\" throughout). Iapetus's two tone coloration is caused by a vast white ellipse on the moon's surface
column3: with the monolith appearing as a black dot in its exact center. When the ''Voyager'' space probes arrived at Iapetus thirteen years later
column4: they discovered that there was indeed a black region within the moon's brighter hemisphere. Clarke reports that [[Carl Sagan]]
column5: who was on the ''Voyager'' imaging team
column6: sent him a photo
column7: with the note \"Thinking of you ...\".<ref>Arthur C. Clarke
column8: Introduction to ''[[2010: Odyssey Two]]'' (1984)</ref>  Because of [[2001: A Space Odyssey (novel)#Differences from the film|difficulties]] achieving a convincing model of Saturn's rings
column9: the film version of ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey (film)|2001: A Space Odyssey]]'' relocated the monolith to an orbit around Jupiter. The three sequel novels written by Clarke follow the film rather than the novel in this matter.

column1: * Iapetus is the setting for ''[[The Saturn Game]]'' (1981) by [[Poul Anderson]].
* Iapetus is the second site of the mysterious phenomenon called \"goorm\" in Sergei Pavlov's hard SF novel ''[[Moon Rainbow]]'' (1984)
column2: first being the Uranus' moon [[Oberon (moon)|Oberon]].

column1: * In [[Kim Stanley Robinson]]'s futuristic novel ''[[The Memory of Whiteness]]'' (1985)
column2: Iapetus is populated by the descendants of [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] colonists who retain a [[Communist]] political system.

column1: * In [[Grant Callin]]'s 1986 science fiction novel ''[[Saturnalia (Callin novel)|Saturnalia]]''
column2: Iapetus is one of the locations of an alien artifact. There is also human colonization and mining at an installation called \"I-Base\".

Iapetus is used as a \"nest\" for a fledgling Titan.  One of the objectives of the ''Ringmaster'' mission to Saturn is to investigate the moon's dark region recently contracting to a narrow band; Gaea reveals this is the result of her offspring entering a new stage of development.  When it is fully mature
column3: Iapetus will be shattered and the new Titan born out of its rubble.

column2: genocidal aliens (the Achuultani) attempt to use Iapetus as a kinetic energy weapon to destroy all life on Earth.
000]]'' universe
column3: Iapetus acts as a dockyard for the Ordo Malleus fleet
column4: as well as that of the Grey Knights chapter of Space Marines.

column2: there is a strange ice-made icon on Iapetus. It leads to a depressing discovery that every intelligent civilization of the Galaxy could be obliterated by an unknown Dark Force from the void between the Galaxy's arms.

column1: * Iapetus is the setting of the book ''Aliens: Steel Egg'' by John Shirley (2007).

column2: a giant city known as the High Street is built along the spine of Iapetus's [[equatorial ridge]].

column1: * In the online comic by Joshua Quagmire
column2: ''Bunz & Katz'' (November 2012 - current) Iapetus is revealed to be an ancient
column3: near-derelict alien battle station which is \"awakened\" by the ''Cassini'' probe fly-by. The series' protagonists are the only surviving scouts from this station.

column1: [[Phoebe (moon)|Phoebe]] is a retrograde orbiting moon in the outer Saturn system. It is the largest of the Saturnian [[irregular moon]]s.

column2: Phoebe is actually an alien biological warhead that was accidentally captured by Saturn on its way to reprogram protozoan life on Earth. The extraction and use as a weapon of the protomolecular payload of Phoebe drives the primary conflicts of the series. After the protomolecule is used against [[433 Eros]]
column3: Phoebe is destroyed via thermonuclear bombardment by the Martian space navy to keep anyone else from obtaining samples
column4: and to prevent it from getting loose in the system.

[[Janus (moon)|Janus]] is a small inner moon of Saturn notable for having an orbit nearly identical to the orbit of the moon [[Epimetheus (moon)|Epimetheus]]; the two swap orbital positions every four years.
*Janus features prominently in [[Alastair Reynolds]]' science fiction novel ''[[Pushing Ice]]'' (2005). In the novel
column2: Janus is revealed to be a shell containing an [[Extraterrestrial life in popular culture|extraterrestrial]] spacecraft which unexpectedly departs the [[solar system]] in the direction of a giant structure orbiting the star [[Spica]]. The novel tells the story of the crew of a human mining ship who establish a colony on the moon as it leaves the [[solar system]].
[[icy moon]] orbiting close to Saturn
column3: notable for being scarred by [[Herschel (Mimantean crater)|Herschel crater]]
column4: whose diameter is very wide compared to the total circumference of the moon.

column1: *In [[Isaac Asimov]]'s 1958 novel ''[[Lucky Starr and the Rings of Saturn]]'' the hero
column2: knowing that Mimas is almost entirely made of ice
column3: guides his ship on a collision course towards it
column4: melts its surface with his weapons
column5: and thus hides the ship in order to escape from his enemies
column6: the people from the Sirius System.

column2: \" a short story by [[Caitlín R. Kiernan]]
column3: Mimas is the destination of a starship manned by two androids.

column1: * Mimas is a recurring location in the ''[[Red Dwarf]]'' TV sitcom and its spinoff novels. In the episode \"[[Dimension Jump (Red Dwarf episode)|Dimension Jump]]\"
column2: Mimas hosts a Space Corps test base for test pilot [[Red Dwarf characters#Ace Rimmer|Arnold J. 'Ace' Rimmer]]
column3: while the first novel
column4: ''[[Infinity Welcomes Careful Drivers]]''
column5: begins with [[Dave Lister]] stranded in a seedy city on Mimas. Both the book and the series refer to the local delicacy \"Mimean Bladderfish\".

column2: episode of ''[[Star Trek: The Next Generation]]''. Mimas is the site of an evacuation station to which four [[Starfleet]] cadets
column3: including [[Wesley Crusher]]
column4: transport after their vessels collide.

column2: Mimas is one of the locations of an alien artifact. It is also the site of human colonization and mining called \"M-Base\".

column3: Mimas serves as a high-security prison for the most dangerous prisoners of the Ordo Malleus branch of the Inquisition.

column1: *In [[Paul J. McAuley]]'s ''[[The Quiet War (novel)|The Quiet War]]'' (2008)
column2: Mimas is home to a notable \"Outer\" family which has profound influence over Jovian/Saturnian satellite politics.
Herschel crater (named Arthur in the story) is the site of the terrestrial part of the sixty-sixth Olympic Winter Games (2194) and the setting of a murder mystery.

column1: *In Alexander Janzer's science fiction novel ''Higher Reality'' (2015)
column2: Mimas is where the protagonist encounters a strange extraterrestrial craft while investigating the disappearance of the crew of a small outpost.
icy moon orbiting close to Saturn
column3: with an extremely bright surface and the geyser-like plumes of ice and water vapor that erupt from its southern polar region. It is the source of material for Saturn's E Ring.

column2: Enceladus makes an appearance. In the story entitled \"[[Killer Kane]] and Ardala on Saturn's moon
column3: \" the titular villains try to take over the peaceful government of the Saturnian moon. The moon is depicted as having an atmosphere and supporting a happy population of [[humanoid]] life. Buck races to the moon to set things right.

column2: Enceladus was the location of a heavily fortified Pirate Clans' outpost and the site of the second battle between them and the [[Exofleet]] just prior to the beginning of the Terran-Neosapien war.

column1: *In Grant D. Callin's science fiction novel ''[[Saturnalia (Callin novel)|Saturnalia]]''
column2: Enceladus is one of the locations of an alien artifact.

column1: *At the conclusion of the [[Time Machine (book series)|Time Machine]] book ''The Rings of Saturn'' (set in 2085)
column2: the spacecraft blows up Enceladus as it returns to [[Earth]] after meeting an alien life-form.
the narrative switches periodically to a robotic probe landing on Enceladus in search of life.

column1: *In [[Paul J. McAuley]]'s ''[[The Quiet War (novel)|The Quiet War]]'' (2008)
column2: Enceladus serves as one of the battlefields as Earth invades Saturn's inhabited satellites in the 23rd Century.

the Terradyne corporation detonates a nuclear explosion on Enceladus to alter its orbit to eventually impact [[Mars]]
column3: as part of its Martian [[terraforming]] project.

column2: Enceladus is referred to as \"Saturn's main dump moon\"
column3: and is the location of a specimen of the cold virus from the 20th century.

column3: but are saved by an ice geyser. The moon is later used as a base for the Earth Defense Fleet by 2202.

column2: characters occasionally refer to the \"Enceladian biota\" – microscopic alien organisms that some humans ingest

column1: [[Dione (moon)|Dione]] is a medium-sized icy moon orbiting close to Saturn

column1: [[Rhea (moon)|Rhea]] is the second-largest moon of Saturn.

60 years prior to the events of the books Rhea rebelled against the society and as a lesson to other inhabited moons and planets was 'glassed' (the surface bombarded until so hot it formed a layer of glass-like rock).

column1: [[Titan (moon)|Titan]] is the largest [[natural satellite|moon]] of [[Saturn]]. Its substantial [[atmosphere]] makes it the most [[Earth]]-like moon in the [[Solar System]] and hence a popular [[science fiction]] setting.

column1: [[Hyperion (moon)|Hyperion]] is the largest irregularly-shaped moon of Saturn
column2: orbiting between Titan and Iapetus.

column1: * Level 16 of the computer game ''[[Descent (video game)|Descent]]'' takes place in a [[methane]] mine on Hyperion.

column2: the eponymous planet was first colonised by settlers from a colony on the moon Hyperion.

column1: * In [[Alastair Reynolds]]' science fiction novel ''[[On the Steel Breeze]]'' (2012)
column2: Hyperion is home to a colony of \"artists and malcontents\".
Hyperion is the site of a self-governed colony independent of the rest of the Alliance.

column1: [[Iapetus (moon)|Iapetus]] is a large moon orbiting further from Saturn than any of its other large satellites.  Half of its surface is very bright while the other half is extremely dark.  Investigations since 2004 have also noted its irregular shape
column2: immense impact basins
column3: and a high mountainous ridge on the equator.

column1: * In [[Theodore Sturgeon]]'s short story \"The Comedian's Children\" (1958)
column2: a manned expedition to Iapetus in 2034 creates a public craze for black/white designs and \"bi-colored gimcrackery\"
column3: but is later linked to ''iapetitis''
column4: a disease in children where one side of the body turns white and paralyzed
column5: the other black.

column1: * In [[Arthur C. Clarke]]'s novel ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey (novel)|2001: A Space Odyssey]]'' (1968)
column2: astronaut Dave Bowman finds an enigmatic alien monolith waiting for him on the surface of Iapetus (referred to as \"Japetus\" throughout). Iapetus's two tone coloration is caused by a vast white ellipse on the moon's surface
column3: with the monolith appearing as a black dot in its exact center. When the ''Voyager'' space probes arrived at Iapetus thirteen years later
column4: they discovered that there was indeed a black region within the moon's brighter hemisphere. Clarke reports that [[Carl Sagan]]
column5: who was on the ''Voyager'' imaging team
column6: sent him a photo
column7: with the note \"Thinking of you ...\".<ref>Arthur C. Clarke
column8: Introduction to ''[[2010: Odyssey Two]]'' (1984)</ref>  Because of [[2001: A Space Odyssey (novel)#Differences from the film|difficulties]] achieving a convincing model of Saturn's rings
column9: the film version of ''[[2001: A Space Odyssey (film)|2001: A Space Odyssey]]'' relocated the monolith to an orbit around Jupiter. The three sequel novels written by Clarke follow the film rather than the novel in this matter.

column1: * Iapetus is the setting for ''[[The Saturn Game]]'' (1981) by [[Poul Anderson]].
* Iapetus is the second site of the mysterious phenomenon called \"goorm\" in Sergei Pavlov's hard SF novel ''[[Moon Rainbow]]'' (1984)
column2: first being the Uranus' moon [[Oberon (moon)|Oberon]].

column1: * In [[Kim Stanley Robinson]]'s futuristic novel ''[[The Memory of Whiteness]]'' (1985)
column2: Iapetus is populated by the descendants of [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] colonists who retain a [[Communist]] political system.

column1: * In [[Grant Callin]]'s 1986 science fiction novel ''[[Saturnalia (Callin novel)|Saturnalia]]''
column2: Iapetus is one of the locations of an alien artifact. There is also human colonization and mining at an installation called \"I-Base\".

Iapetus is used as a \"nest\" for a fledgling Titan.  One of the objectives of the ''Ringmaster'' mission to Saturn is to investigate the moon's dark region recently contracting to a narrow band; Gaea reveals this is the result of her offspring entering a new stage of development.  When it is fully mature
column3: Iapetus will be shattered and the new Titan born out of its rubble.

column2: genocidal aliens (the Achuultani) attempt to use Iapetus as a kinetic energy weapon to destroy all life on Earth.
000]]'' universe
column3: Iapetus acts as a dockyard for the Ordo Malleus fleet
column4: as well as that of the Grey Knights chapter of Space Marines.

column2: there is a strange ice-made icon on Iapetus. It leads to a depressing discovery that every intelligent civilization of the Galaxy could be obliterated by an unknown Dark Force from the void between the Galaxy's arms.

column1: * Iapetus is the setting of the book ''Aliens: Steel Egg'' by John Shirley (2007).

column2: a giant city known as the High Street is built along the spine of Iapetus's [[equatorial ridge]].

column1: * In the online comic by Joshua Quagmire
column2: ''Bunz & Katz'' (November 2012 - current) Iapetus is revealed to be an ancient
column3: near-derelict alien battle station which is \"awakened\" by the ''Cassini'' probe fly-by. The series' protagonists are the only surviving scouts from this station.

column1: [[Phoebe (moon)|Phoebe]] is a retrograde orbiting moon in the outer Saturn system. It is the largest of the Saturnian [[irregular moon]]s.

column2: Phoebe is actually an alien biological warhead that was accidentally captured by Saturn on its way to reprogram protozoan life on Earth. The extraction and use as a weapon of the protomolecular payload of Phoebe drives the primary conflicts of the series. After the protomolecule is used against [[433 Eros]]
column3: Phoebe is destroyed via thermonuclear bombardment by the Martian space navy to keep anyone else from obtaining samples
column4: and to prevent it from getting loose in the system.

{{Use mdy dates|date=January 2015}} {{Infobox military person |name = James Fannin |image = JamesWFannin.jpg |caption = James Fannin ''circa'' 1820s |nickname = |occupation = judge, illegal slave trader, soldier |birth_name= James Walker Fannin Jr. |birth_date= 1804/1805 |birth_place = [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], U.S. |death_date= March 27, 1836 |death_place = [[Presidio La Bahía|Fort Defiance]], [[Republic of Texas]] |allegiance = [[Republic of Texas]] |branch =[[Texan Army]] |serviceyears = 1834–1836 |rank = [[Colonel (United States)|Colonel]] |unit = |battles =[[Texas Revolution]]
{{*}}[[Battle of Gonzales]]
{{*}}[[Battle of Coleto|Battle of Coleto Creek]]
{{*}}Alamo Campaign
{{*}}[[Battle of Goliad]] }} '''James Walker Fannin Jr.''' (1804 or 1805 – March 27, 1836) was a 19th-century American military figure in the Texas Army and leader during the [[Texas Revolution]] of 1835–36. After being outnumbered and surrendering to Mexican forces at the [[Battle of Coleto Creek]], Colonel Fannin and [[Goliad massacre|nearly all his 344 men were executed]] soon afterward at [[Goliad, Texas]], under [[Antonio López de Santa Anna|Santa Anna]]'s orders for all rebels to be executed. He was memorialized in several place names, including a military training camp and a major city street of Houston. Booty juice ==Early life and family== Different sources say his year of birth as either 1804 or 1805.{{cite web|last1=Hartmann|first1=Clinton P.|title=James Walker Fannin|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/ffa02|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 10, 2015}} He was born in Georgia to Isham Fannin, a veteran of the [[War of 1812]]. His mother's last name was Walker. Although she was not married to his father, the Walker family raised him. His ancestors, who spelled the family name Fanning, lived in America during the [[American Revolutionary War|Revolutionary War]], a family with divided loyalties during the conflict. Isham's father James W. Fannin dropped the \g\" from the family name and settled in [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]].Brown (2000) pp.3-5

column1: Fannin enrolled in the [[United States Military Academy]] at [[West Point]] on July 1
column2: 1819.<ref>Brown (2000) p. 5</ref> He resigned November 20
column4: from the school. Although he seems to have been academically deficient
column5: and was often tardy or absent from classes
column6: he had received a letter from a cousin urging his immediate return to Georgia to attend to ailing grandparents.<ref>Brown (2000) p. 6</ref>

column1: He married Minerva Fort. Their daughter
column2: Missouri Pinckney
column3: was born on July 17
column4: 1829.<ref>Brown (2000) p. 10</ref> A second daughter
column5: Minerva
column6: nicknamed Eliza
column7: was born mentally ill in 1832.<ref name=\"B1213\">Brown (2000) pp. 12-16</ref> While living in [[Columbus
column8: Georgia]]
column9: he enlisted in the [[Militia (United States)|militia]] and worked as a merchant.<ref>Brown (2000) p.8</ref> In [[Muscogee County
column11: he was a member of the Temperance Society and served for a short time as a judge.<ref>Brown (2000) pp.8-9</ref> By 1832
column12: Fannin was involved in the (illegal) business of transporting slaves.

column2: Fannin settled his family at [[Velasco
column3: Texas|Velasco]]
column4: in colonial [[Coahuila y Tejas|Tejas]] (now Texas)
column5: where he owned a [[Plantations in the American South|plantation]] and was a managing partner in a slave-trading syndicate.<ref>Brown (2000) pp. 21
column7: Fannin was involved in the growing [[English American|Anglo-American]] resistance to the [[Mexican Texas|Mexican government in Texas]]. He wrote letters seeking financial assistance and volunteers to help Texas. By September
column8: Fannin was an active volunteer in the Texas Army.<ref>Brown (2000) p. 2</ref>

column1: He took part in the [[Battle of Gonzales]] on October 2 and urged [[Stephen F. Austin]] to send aid to Gonzales. Fannin later worked with [[James Bowie]]
column2: First Battalion
column3: First Division
column4: under Austin's orders to secure supplies and determine the conditions in and around Gonzales and [[San Antonio de Bexar]].

column1: {{quote|Fellow citizens ... We urge as many as can possibly leave their homes to repair to Gonzales immediately
column2: \"armed and equipped for war even to the knife.\" ...If Texas will now act promptly
column3: she will soon be redeemed from that worse than Egyptian bondage which now cramps her resources and retards her prosperity.|J.W. Fannin. Jr. (et al)
column4: October 2

column2: <ref>Brown (2000) p. 42</ref> Fannin fought in the [[Battle of Concepción]] on October 28
column3: 1835.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Barr|first1=Alwyn|title=Battle of Concepción|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/qec02|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 10

column2: Austin ordered Fannin and [[William B. Travis]] and about 150 men to cut off any Mexican supply party. On November 13
column3: Houston offered Fannin the post of [[inspector general]] to the regular army.<ref name=HoTFannin/> Fannin wrote back requesting a field appointment of [[brigadier general]] and a \"post of danger\". On November 22
column5: Fannin was honorably discharged from the volunteer army by Austin and began campaigning for a larger regular army for Texas. He also went home to spend time with his family.<ref name=HoTFannin/>

column2: supported by Governor [[Henry Smith (Texas Governor)|Henry Smith]]
column3: commissioned Fannin as a [[colonel]] in the regular army on December 7
column4: 1835. By January 7
column6: the provisional government had appointed Fannin \"military agent\"
column7: to answer only to the council and not Houston. He began recruiting forces and supplies for the forthcoming and confusing [[Matamoros Expedition|Matamoros campaign]] against the Mexican city of [[Matamoros
column8: Tamaulipas]]. Fannin had difficulty leading the volunteers in his charge. He tried to institute regular Army discipline
column9: but his [[irregular military|irregular]] volunteers would not accept it. Many of his men thought he was aloof
column10: and several historians believe that he was an ineffective commander because of it. The majority of the men serving under Fannin had been in Texas only a short time; he was frustrated by this
column11: writing to Lt. Governor [[James W. Robinson (Texas and California)|James W. Robinson]] \"... among the rise of 400 men at
column13: I doubt if 25 citizens of Texas can be mustered in the ranks...\".<ref name=bradle135>Bradle (2007)

column2: Fannin sailed from Velasco and landed at Copano with four companies of the Georgia Battalion
column3: moving to join a small band of [[Texian]]s at [[Refugio
column4: Texas|Refugio]]. Mexican reinforcements under General [[Jose Urrea]] arrived at [[Matamoros
column5: Tamaulipas|Matamoros]]
column6: complicating the Texian plans to attack that city. Fannin withdrew 25 miles north to [[Goliad
column7: Texas|Goliad]].

column1: ==Failed expedition to support the Alamo and aftermath==
Appeals from Travis at the Alamo  (via [[James Bonham]]) prompted Fannin to launch a relief march of more than 300 men and four pieces of artillery on February 25
column2: 1836. After some delay
column3: Fannin and his men moved out on the 28th for the journey to San Antonio
column4: a distance of more than 90 miles. The relief mission was a failure. The troops barely had crossed the [[San Antonio River]] when wagons broke down
column5: prompting the men to camp within sight of [[Goliad]].<ref>Moore (2004) p.28</ref> They had little or no food
column6: some men were barefooted
column7: and the oxen teams wandered off during the night. On March 6
column9: the [[Battle of the Alamo]] was fought
column10: with all the Alamo's defenders (about 187 men) being killed by Mexican forces.

column1: The Mexican forces under General José de Urrea were now rapidly approaching the Texan stronghold in Goliad. They defeated Texian forces at the [[Battle of San Patricio]] on February 27
column2: where 20 were killed and prisoners were taken. [[Frank W. Johnson]] and four other Texians were captured
column3: but later managed to escape and rejoin James Fannin's command at Goliad.<ref>Todish
column4: .Todish
column5: Spring (1998) p.128</ref>

column1: The [[Battle of Agua Dulce]] was fought on March 2. Dr. [[James Grant (Texas)|James Grant]]
column2: Robert C. Morris and 12 others were killed
column3: with prisoners taken. [[Plácido Benavides]] and six others escaped to notify Fannin of the situation.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bishop|first1=Curtis|title=Battle of Agua Dulce Creek|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/qfa01|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 11

column2: Fannin sent Captain [[Amon B. King]] and about 28 men to take wagons to Refugio to help evacuate the remaining families.<ref>Moore (2004) p.67</ref> King and his men confronted an advance party of General Urrea's cavalry in the [[Battle of Refugio]]; his defense failed and he withdrew to the old mission.<ref>Todish
column3: .Todish
column4: Spring (1998) p.129</ref> A local boy managed to get away and alerted Fannin to the skirmish. Fannin sent Lieutenant Colonel [[William Ward (Texas)|William Ward]] and about 120 men to King's aid. Ward managed to drive the small Mexican force away and decided to stay the night to rest his men.

column3: Ward and King were attacked by Urrea and more than 200 Mexican soldiers as they were about to leave. This detachment was part of Urrea's larger force of nearly 1
column4: 200 men. The same day
column5: General Houston ordered Fannin to retreat to [[Victoria
column6: Texas|Victoria]]. Fannin sent word to the men at Refugio to rendezvous with his command at Victoria. Other dispatches were intercepted by the Centralista forces
column7: informing them of Fannin's plans.<ref name=Goliad>{{cite web|last1=Roell|first1=Craig H.|last2=Davenport|first2=Herbert|title=Goliad Campaign of 1836|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/qdg02|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 11
column8: 2015}}</ref> Fannin needed means of transport and had sent [[Albert C. Horton]] and his men to Victoria
column9: to bring carts and 20 yokes of oxen from Army quartermaster John J. Linn
column10: who did return around March 16. Horton's men would later form Fannin's advance guard during the retreat to Victoria.<ref name=Coleto/> Fannin finally received the news of King and Ward's defeat from Hugh McDonald Frazer on March 17.<ref name=Goliad/>

column3: Fannin led the Texians on a retreat from [[Presidio La Bahia]] (which Fannin had renamed Fort Defiance)<ref name=Coleto>{{cite web|last1=Roell|first1=Craig H.|title=Battle of Coleto Creek|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/qec01|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 10
column4: 2015}}</ref> and destroyed everything which they could not take with them.{{citation needed|date=March 2016}}

column1: Transporting nine cannons and more than 500 spare muskets
column2: Fannin's forces were also heavily laden with supplies and baggage. The column had traveled about 6 miles when Fannin ordered a halt to rest his animals. At about 3 pm
column3: Mexican cavalry appeared. The Texians immediately formed a [[Infantry square|hollow square]] with their wagons and cannon placed in each corner for defense as Gen. Urrea's forces attacked. After a fierce battle
column4: the Mexicans lost about 100 to 200 killed and wounded; Texian losses were seven to nine killed and 60 wounded. Facing overwhelming odds
column5: though
column6: Fannin and his troops surrendered the next day
column7: at the [[Battle of Coleto]].<ref name=hardin173>Hardin (1994)

column1: The Mexicans took the Texans back to Goliad
column2: where they were held as prisoners at Fort Defiance. The Texans thought they would likely be set free in a few weeks. General Urrea left Goliad
column3: leaving command to Colonel Jose Nicolas de la Portilla. Urrea wrote to Santa Anna to ask for clemency for the Texans.  Urrea wrote in his diary that he \"... wished to elude these orders as far as possible without compromising my personal responsibility.\" On March 26
column6: Santa Anna ordered Portilla to execute the prisoners.<ref name=hardin173/>

column2: [[Palm Sunday]]
column3: March 27
column5: Colonel Portilla had 400 Texans marched out of Fort Defiance into three columns on the Bexar Road
column6: San Patricio Road
column7: and Victoria Road. They were shot point blank
column8: between two rows of Mexican soldiers
column9: and any survivors were clubbed or knifed to death.<ref name=hardin173/>

column1: The 40 wounded men who could not walk were executed inside the fort compound. Fannin was the last to be executed
column2: after seeing his men killed. He was taken by Mexican soldiers to the courtyard in front of the chapel
column3: blindfolded
column4: and seated in a chair (due to his leg wound from the battle). He made three requests: he asked for his personal possessions to be sent to his family
column5: to be shot in his heart and not his face
column6: and to be given a Christian burial. The soldiers took his belongings
column7: shot him in the face
column8: and burned Fannin's body along with the other Texans who died that day.<ref name=hardin174>Hardin (1994)

{{Use mdy dates|date=January 2015}} {{Infobox military person |name = James Fannin |image = JamesWFannin.jpg |caption = James Fannin ''circa'' 1820s |nickname = |occupation = judge, illegal slave trader, soldier |birth_name= James Walker Fannin Jr. |birth_date= 1804/1805 |birth_place = [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]], U.S. |death_date= March 27, 1836 |death_place = [[Presidio La Bahía|Fort Defiance]], [[Republic of Texas]] |allegiance = [[Republic of Texas]] |branch =[[Texan Army]] |serviceyears = 1834–1836 |rank = [[Colonel (United States)|Colonel]] |unit = |battles =[[Texas Revolution]]
{{*}}[[Battle of Gonzales]]
{{*}}[[Battle of Coleto|Battle of Coleto Creek]]
{{*}}Alamo Campaign
{{*}}[[Battle of Goliad]] }} '''James Walker Fannin Jr.''' (1804 or 1805 – March 27, 1836) was a 19th-century American military figure in the Texas Army and leader during the [[Texas Revolution]] of 1835–36. After being outnumbered and surrendering to Mexican forces at the [[Battle of Coleto Creek]], Colonel Fannin and [[Goliad massacre|nearly all his 344 men were executed]] soon afterward at [[Goliad, Texas]], under [[Antonio López de Santa Anna|Santa Anna]]'s orders for all rebels to be executed. He was memorialized in several place names, including a military training camp and a major city street of Houston. ==Early life and family== Different sources say his year of birth as either 1804 or 1805.{{cite web|last1=Hartmann|first1=Clinton P.|title=James Walker Fannin|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/ffa02|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 10, 2015}} He was born in Georgia to Isham Fannin, a veteran of the [[War of 1812]]. His mother's last name was Walker. Although she was not married to his father, the Walker family raised him. His ancestors, who spelled the family name Fanning, lived in America during the [[American Revolutionary War|Revolutionary War]], a family with divided loyalties during the conflict. Isham's father James W. Fannin dropped the \g\" from the family name and settled in [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]].Brown (2000) pp.3-5

column1: Fannin enrolled in the [[United States Military Academy]] at [[West Point]] on July 1
column2: 1819.<ref>Brown (2000) p. 5</ref> He resigned November 20
column4: from the school. Although he seems to have been academically deficient
column5: and was often tardy or absent from classes
column6: he had received a letter from a cousin urging his immediate return to Georgia to attend to ailing grandparents.<ref>Brown (2000) p. 6</ref>

column1: He married Minerva Fort. Their daughter
column2: Missouri Pinckney
column3: was born on July 17
column4: 1829.<ref>Brown (2000) p. 10</ref> A second daughter
column5: Minerva
column6: nicknamed Eliza
column7: was born mentally ill in 1832.<ref name=\"B1213\">Brown (2000) pp. 12-16</ref> While living in [[Columbus
column8: Georgia]]
column9: he enlisted in the [[Militia (United States)|militia]] and worked as a merchant.<ref>Brown (2000) p.8</ref> In [[Muscogee County
column11: he was a member of the Temperance Society and served for a short time as a judge.<ref>Brown (2000) pp.8-9</ref> By 1832
column12: Fannin was involved in the (illegal) business of transporting slaves.

column2: Fannin settled his family at [[Velasco
column3: Texas|Velasco]]
column4: in colonial [[Coahuila y Tejas|Tejas]] (now Texas)
column5: where he owned a [[Plantations in the American South|plantation]] and was a managing partner in a slave-trading syndicate.<ref>Brown (2000) pp. 21
column7: Fannin was involved in the growing [[English American|Anglo-American]] resistance to the [[Mexican Texas|Mexican government in Texas]]. He wrote letters seeking financial assistance and volunteers to help Texas. By September
column8: Fannin was an active volunteer in the Texas Army.<ref>Brown (2000) p. 2</ref>

column1: He took part in the [[Battle of Gonzales]] on October 2 and urged [[Stephen F. Austin]] to send aid to Gonzales. Fannin later worked with [[James Bowie]]
column2: First Battalion
column3: First Division
column4: under Austin's orders to secure supplies and determine the conditions in and around Gonzales and [[San Antonio de Bexar]].

column1: {{quote|Fellow citizens ... We urge as many as can possibly leave their homes to repair to Gonzales immediately
column2: \"armed and equipped for war even to the knife.\" ...If Texas will now act promptly
column3: she will soon be redeemed from that worse than Egyptian bondage which now cramps her resources and retards her prosperity.|J.W. Fannin. Jr. (et al)
column4: October 2

column2: <ref>Brown (2000) p. 42</ref> Fannin fought in the [[Battle of Concepción]] on October 28
column3: 1835.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Barr|first1=Alwyn|title=Battle of Concepción|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/qec02|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 10

column2: Austin ordered Fannin and [[William B. Travis]] and about 150 men to cut off any Mexican supply party. On November 13
column3: Houston offered Fannin the post of [[inspector general]] to the regular army.<ref name=HoTFannin/> Fannin wrote back requesting a field appointment of [[brigadier general]] and a \"post of danger\". On November 22
column5: Fannin was honorably discharged from the volunteer army by Austin and began campaigning for a larger regular army for Texas. He also went home to spend time with his family.<ref name=HoTFannin/>

column2: supported by Governor [[Henry Smith (Texas Governor)|Henry Smith]]
column3: commissioned Fannin as a [[colonel]] in the regular army on December 7
column4: 1835. By January 7
column6: the provisional government had appointed Fannin \"military agent\"
column7: to answer only to the council and not Houston. He began recruiting forces and supplies for the forthcoming and confusing [[Matamoros Expedition|Matamoros campaign]] against the Mexican city of [[Matamoros
column8: Tamaulipas]]. Fannin had difficulty leading the volunteers in his charge. He tried to institute regular Army discipline
column9: but his [[irregular military|irregular]] volunteers would not accept it. Many of his men thought he was aloof
column10: and several historians believe that he was an ineffective commander because of it. The majority of the men serving under Fannin had been in Texas only a short time; he was frustrated by this
column11: writing to Lt. Governor [[James W. Robinson (Texas and California)|James W. Robinson]] \"... among the rise of 400 men at
column13: I doubt if 25 citizens of Texas can be mustered in the ranks...\".<ref name=bradle135>Bradle (2007)

column2: Fannin sailed from Velasco and landed at Copano with four companies of the Georgia Battalion
column3: moving to join a small band of [[Texian]]s at [[Refugio
column4: Texas|Refugio]]. Mexican reinforcements under General [[Jose Urrea]] arrived at [[Matamoros
column5: Tamaulipas|Matamoros]]
column6: complicating the Texian plans to attack that city. Fannin withdrew 25 miles north to [[Goliad
column7: Texas|Goliad]].

column1: ==Failed expedition to support the Alamo and aftermath==
Appeals from Travis at the Alamo  (via [[James Bonham]]) prompted Fannin to launch a relief march of more than 300 men and four pieces of artillery on February 25
column2: 1836. After some delay
column3: Fannin and his men moved out on the 28th for the journey to San Antonio
column4: a distance of more than 90 miles. The relief mission was a failure. The troops barely had crossed the [[San Antonio River]] when wagons broke down
column5: prompting the men to camp within sight of [[Goliad]].<ref>Moore (2004) p.28</ref> They had little or no food
column6: some men were barefooted
column7: and the oxen teams wandered off during the night. On March 6
column9: the [[Battle of the Alamo]] was fought
column10: with all the Alamo's defenders (about 187 men) being killed by Mexican forces.

column1: The Mexican forces under General José de Urrea were now rapidly approaching the Texan stronghold in Goliad. They defeated Texian forces at the [[Battle of San Patricio]] on February 27
column2: where 20 were killed and prisoners were taken. [[Frank W. Johnson]] and four other Texians were captured
column3: but later managed to escape and rejoin James Fannin's command at Goliad.<ref>Todish
column4: .Todish
column5: Spring (1998) p.128</ref>

column1: The [[Battle of Agua Dulce]] was fought on March 2. Dr. [[James Grant (Texas)|James Grant]]
column2: Robert C. Morris and 12 others were killed
column3: with prisoners taken. [[Plácido Benavides]] and six others escaped to notify Fannin of the situation.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bishop|first1=Curtis|title=Battle of Agua Dulce Creek|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/qfa01|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 11

column2: Fannin sent Captain [[Amon B. King]] and about 28 men to take wagons to Refugio to help evacuate the remaining families.<ref>Moore (2004) p.67</ref> King and his men confronted an advance party of General Urrea's cavalry in the [[Battle of Refugio]]; his defense failed and he withdrew to the old mission.<ref>Todish
column3: .Todish
column4: Spring (1998) p.129</ref> A local boy managed to get away and alerted Fannin to the skirmish. Fannin sent Lieutenant Colonel [[William Ward (Texas)|William Ward]] and about 120 men to King's aid. Ward managed to drive the small Mexican force away and decided to stay the night to rest his men.

column3: Ward and King were attacked by Urrea and more than 200 Mexican soldiers as they were about to leave. This detachment was part of Urrea's larger force of nearly 1
column4: 200 men. The same day
column5: General Houston ordered Fannin to retreat to [[Victoria
column6: Texas|Victoria]]. Fannin sent word to the men at Refugio to rendezvous with his command at Victoria. Other dispatches were intercepted by the Centralista forces
column7: informing them of Fannin's plans.<ref name=Goliad>{{cite web|last1=Roell|first1=Craig H.|last2=Davenport|first2=Herbert|title=Goliad Campaign of 1836|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/qdg02|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 11
column8: 2015}}</ref> Fannin needed means of transport and had sent [[Albert C. Horton]] and his men to Victoria
column9: to bring carts and 20 yokes of oxen from Army quartermaster John J. Linn
column10: who did return around March 16. Horton's men would later form Fannin's advance guard during the retreat to Victoria.<ref name=Coleto/> Fannin finally received the news of King and Ward's defeat from Hugh McDonald Frazer on March 17.<ref name=Goliad/>

column3: Fannin led the Texians on a retreat from [[Presidio La Bahia]] (which Fannin had renamed Fort Defiance)<ref name=Coleto>{{cite web|last1=Roell|first1=Craig H.|title=Battle of Coleto Creek|url=http://www.tshaonline.org/handbook/online/articles/qec01|website=Handbook of Texas Online|publisher=Texas State Historical Association|accessdate=January 10
column4: 2015}}</ref> and destroyed everything which they could not take with them.{{citation needed|date=March 2016}}

column1: Transporting nine cannons and more than 500 spare muskets
column2: Fannin's forces were also heavily laden with supplies and baggage. The column had traveled about 6 miles when Fannin ordered a halt to rest his animals. At about 3 pm
column3: Mexican cavalry appeared. The Texians immediately formed a [[Infantry square|hollow square]] with their wagons and cannon placed in each corner for defense as Gen. Urrea's forces attacked. After a fierce battle
column4: the Mexicans lost about 100 to 200 killed and wounded; Texian losses were seven to nine killed and 60 wounded. Facing overwhelming odds
column5: though
column6: Fannin and his troops surrendered the next day
column7: at the [[Battle of Coleto]].<ref name=hardin173>Hardin (1994)

column1: The Mexicans took the Texans back to Goliad
column2: where they were held as prisoners at Fort Defiance. The Texans thought they would likely be set free in a few weeks. General Urrea left Goliad
column3: leaving command to Colonel Jose Nicolas de la Portilla. Urrea wrote to Santa Anna to ask for clemency for the Texans.  Urrea wrote in his diary that he \"... wished to elude these orders as far as possible without compromising my personal responsibility.\" On March 26
column6: Santa Anna ordered Portilla to execute the prisoners.<ref name=hardin173/>

column2: [[Palm Sunday]]
column3: March 27
column5: Colonel Portilla had 400 Texans marched out of Fort Defiance into three columns on the Bexar Road
column6: San Patricio Road
column7: and Victoria Road. They were shot point blank
column8: between two rows of Mexican soldiers
column9: and any survivors were clubbed or knifed to death.<ref name=hardin173/>

column1: The 40 wounded men who could not walk were executed inside the fort compound. Fannin was the last to be executed
column2: after seeing his men killed. He was taken by Mexican soldiers to the courtyard in front of the chapel
column3: blindfolded
column4: and seated in a chair (due to his leg wound from the battle). He made three requests: he asked for his personal possessions to be sent to his family
column5: to be shot in his heart and not his face
column6: and to be given a Christian burial. The soldiers took his belongings
column7: shot him in the face
column8: and burned Fannin's body along with the other Texans who died that day.<ref name=hardin174>Hardin (1994)
column9: p. 174</ref><ref>[http://www.presidiolabahia.org/frequently_asked_questions.htm \"Frequently Asked Questions\"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130309031543/http://www.presidiolabahia.org/frequently_asked_questions.htm |date=March 9

{{Multiple issues| {{More citations needed|date=January 2017}} {{Cleanup rewrite|date=November 2013}}}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2012}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Drudkh | image = drudkh logo.jpg | caption = Drudkh's logo | image_size = | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Kharkiv]], [[Ukraine]] | genre = [[Black metal]]{{cite web |author=True, Chris |title=Drudkh - Music Biography, Credits and Discography |url=http://www.allmusic.com/artist/drudkh-mn0002065474 |work=[[AllMusic]] |accessdate=October 13, 2011}} | years_active = 2002–present | label = [[Season of Mist]] | associated_acts = [[Hate Forest]], [[Astrofaes]], [[Blood of Kingu]], [[Windswept(band)|Windswept]] | website = {{facebook|Drudkh.Official}} | current_members = Roman Saenko
Thurios
Krechet
Vlad }} '''Drudkh''' is a Ukrainian [[black metal]] band. It currently consists of {{ill|Roman Saenko|uk|Роман Саєнко}} (former member of [[Hate Forest]] and [[Dark Ages (band)|Dark Ages]]), Thurios (former member of [[Astrofaes]]), Krechet, and Vlad. All four also belonged to [[Blood of Kingu]] until it was disbanded. Their lyrics embrace [[Slavic mythology]]. Many of the band's lyrics are derived from the works of nineteenth- and twentieth-century Ukrainian poets ([[Oleksandr Oles]], [[Oleh Olzhych]], [[Maik Yohansen]] etc.) and especially [[Taras Shevchenko]]. Drudkh have been particularly secretive throughout the course of their career, even for a black metal band, giving no interviews and not releasing the lyrics to several of their albums. The band is not explicitly political in its lyrics and has denied links to fascism or any other political ideology. However, Hate Forest, Saekno's previous band, was more explicitly involved in the NSBM scene, and Drudkh's music has repeatedly referenced the [[Ukrainian Insurgent Army]], a [[Ukrainian nationalism|Ukrainian nationalist]] formation from World War II that committed [[ethnic cleansing]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.splicetoday.com/music/fascist-folk|title=Fascist Folk|last=Berlatsky|first=Noah|date=September 10, 2009|website=[[Splice Today]]|language=en|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=2020-04-12}} From their conception until 2009, Drudkh did not have any official website, but in May 2009, [[Season of Mist]] launched an official [[Myspace]], operated by the label rather than the band. ==History== Drudkh have released ten albums, two EPs, three splits, and one anthology collecting material from the band's early splits and EPs. Their early releases were released on CD through the [[England|English]] [[extreme metal]] record label [[Supernal Music]], with the exception of the EP (which was a vinyl release), and, again with the exception of the EP, on vinyl through two [[Finland|Finnish]] black metal labels, [[Northern Heritage]] and Faustian Distribution. More recent release have been through Season of Mist, which has also issued remastered versions of the band's earlier albums as [[digipak]]s. The band's first album, ''[[Forgotten Legends]]'', was released on August 18, 2003. The album establishes the band's trademark epic sound; its three tracks and one [[conclusion (music)|outro]] span nearly forty minutes, with the longest track, \False Dawn\"
column5: nearing the sixteen-minute mark. ''[[Terrorizer (magazine)|Terrorizer]]'' included ''Forgotten Legends'' in its Top 40 Black Metal albums list.<ref>{{cite web

column1: | title = Terrorizer Magazine's Top 40 Black Metal Albums

column2: 2004 (see [[2004 in music]]). While continuing its predecessor's general mood and atmosphere
column3: it distinguishes itself by incorporating [[synthesizer]]s and other such [[keyboard instrument]]s. ''Autumn Aurora'' has frequently been cited as Drudkh's finest album
column4: although some fans give the nod to the later ''[[Blood in Our Wells]]''.{{Citation needed|date=September 2008}} This record had a strong critical success: for example
column5: it was chosen the best album of the year by [[Chronicles of Chaos (webzine)|Chronicles of Chaos]] web-zine.<ref>{{cite web

column1: | title = CoC : Rant : Best Albums of 2004

column2: Amorth (drums
column3: keyboards) joined the band and replaced Yuriy.

column2: released on March 14
column3: 2005 (see [[2005 in music]])
column4: marked a departure in a number of ways. It was well reviewed and is the first Drudkh album to have Ukrainian lyrics
column5: all of which are adapted or taken directly from the work ''[[Haydamaky (poem)|The Haidamakas]]'' ([[1841 in literature|1841]]) by [[Taras Shevchenko]]
column6: narrating about the [[Koliyivshchyna|Ukrainian anti-Polish uprising]] of 1768.<ref>{{cite web

column2: Smierc

column1: }}</ref> Its CD booklet included prints of Shevchenko's notebooks
column2: which many non-Ukrainian-speaking fans mistook for song lyrics. The addition of Shevchenko's poetry can also be said to have given Drudkh's music a more pronounced [[Ukrainian nationalism|nationalistic leaning]] (a move continued on the next album). The music's atmosphere is also significantly more urgent
column3: with the drums pushed to the forefront of the mix and a vastly increased use of [[blast beat]]s.

column2: 2006 (see [[2006 in music]])

column4: once again through Supernal Music. On this album
column5: poetry from four nineteenth- and twentieth-century Ukrainian poets (including [[Oleksandr Oles]] and [[Lina Kostenko]]) serves as lyrical material
column6: and the album itself was dedicated to [[Stepan Bandera]]
column7: leader of the [[Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists]]. Musically
column8: the album adds [[progressive rock]] influences and an increased use of traditional [[heavy metal music|heavy metal]] [[guitar solo|soloing]] into the mix
column9: while retaining the band's tradition of blending black metal and Ukrainian folk music. In part because several tracks sample the Ukrainian poetic film ''[[Mamay (film)|Mamay]]'' (2003)
column10: the album is considered more cinematic than its predecessors. Many fans have cited this album as the band's best work to date. It was Drudkh's first record to appear in the ''[[Terrorizer (magazine)|Terrorizer]]'' Top 40 year list

column6: \"Bitch I'm Posh\".<ref name=\"autogenerated2\" /><ref>[http://noisey.vice.com/ja/blog/wavy-spice-bitch-im-posh Wavy Spice\" \"Bitch I'm Posh\"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140220182519/http://noisey.vice.com/ja/blog/wavy-spice-bitch-im-posh |date=2014-02-20 }}</ref><ref name=\"paper\" /> The track went viral

Accessed 27 November 2016</ref> Frasqueri then released ''YAYA (Yaya is a [[Taíno|Taino]] word)''<ref>{{Citation|last=Princess Nokia|title=Wavy Spice - YAYA|date=2012-10-29|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=90Y9BdyZcQc|accessdate=2018-05-10}}</ref> as a commentary of perceptions of colonial history.<ref name=\"Remezcla\">{{Cite news|url=http://remezcla.com/features/music/princess-nokia-new-age-hood-leader/|title=Princess Nokia is Our New Age Hood Leader|work=Remezcla|access-date=2017-10-05|language=en-US}}</ref>

column5: and ''Vicki Gotti'' until changing their moniker to Princess Nokia. They released their mixtape
column7: on Soundcloud and began touring.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://soundcloud.com/princessnokiaofficial/sets/1992-deluxe|title=1992 Deluxe|website=SoundCloud|language=en|access-date=2018-01-06}}</ref>

column1: Frasqueri claims Princess Nokia is an [[alter ego]]
column2: <ref>[http://bullettmedia.com/article/wavy-spice-harlem-is-burning/ Wavy Spice: Harlem Is Burning]</ref> which they introduced with the track \"Nokia\".<ref name=\"autogenerated2\">[http://bullettmedia.com/article/hear-wavy-spice-transform-into-princess-nokia-on-nokia/ Track Premiere: Hear Wavy Spice Transform Into Princess Nokia on 'Nokia'<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> They released an album named ''Metallic Butterfly'' on May 12
column4: and was debuted on ''[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]'' and Soundcloud.<ref>{{cite news|title=Princess Nokia's 'Metallic Butterfly'|url=https://www.vice.com/read/princess-nokias-metallic-butterfly|accessdate=5 December 2014|work=Vice|date=12 May 2014}}</ref>

column2: Frasqueri confronted a member of the audience at a charity concert at [[Cambridge University]] whom they accused of \"mouthing dirty obscenities like 'show me your tits'.\" The alleged harasser denied yelling such obscenities and told ''[[The Cambridge Student]]'': \"I was standing in the audience and was told by a fellow audience member that the name of the performer was 'Abigail'. Given that I was enjoying the performance
column3: I shouted out 'Let's go Abigail!'. After I shouted this
column4: they came down from the stage. They slapped me and threw drinks on me.\"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.out.com/music/2017/2/22/rapper-princess-nokia-punches-audience-member-after-being-harassed-stage|title=Rapper Princess Nokia Punches Audience Member After Being Harassed On Stage|date=22 February 2017|work=[[Out (magazine)|Out]]|accessdate=23 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tcs.cam.ac.uk/news/0036769-fashion-show-headliner-ends-set-early-after-hitting-audience-member.html|title=Fashion show headliner ends set early after hitting audience member|date=15 February 2017|work=[[The Cambridge Student]]|accessdate=23 February 2017|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170224061717/http://www.tcs.cam.ac.uk/news/0036769-fashion-show-headliner-ends-set-early-after-hitting-audience-member.html|archive-date=24 February 2017}}</ref> After returning to the stage
column5: Nokia told the crowd \"that's what you do when a White boy disrespects you\".<ref>https://heatst.com/culture-wars/rapper-princess-nokia-assaults-white-boy-in-audience-who-called-her-abigail/</ref>

column2: Frasqueri made headlines again when a viral video surfaced of them throwing hot soup in a man's face whilst on a subway journey to [[Brooklyn]].<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite news|url=https://bust.com/feminism/193616-princess-nokia-armed-with-a-fist-full-of-soup-fights-off-a-subway-racist.html|title=Princess Nokia
column3: Armed With Soup
column4: Fights Off a Subway Racist|access-date=2018-03-07|language=en-gb}}</ref> The rapper heard a white man shouting racial slurs at a group of teenagers
column5: and decided to take action against the racist remarks by slapping the man and throwing their hot soup on him.<ref name=\":0\" /> They took to [[Twitter]] saying: \"this bigot called this group of teenage boys 'n****s' on the train so I stood up and slapped him and everybody on the train backed me up\".<ref name=\":0\" />

column1: Nokia also has debuted a new radio show on Apple's Beats 1 Radio on February 18
column2: 2018. Episodes will air every other Sunday and allow listeners to get acquainted with the inner workings of Nokia's mind. column2: Nokia re-released the album ''Metallic Butterfly'' under the label Rough Trade.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://audiodorks.com/music/1445516354/metallic-butterfly-princess-nokia|title=Metallic Butterfly|publisher=Rough Trade|accessdate=14 December 2018}}</ref> In 2019 they had their debut performance as an actor in the indie movie ''“Angelfish\"''.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://filmthreat.com/reviews/angelfish/|title=Angelfish by Brian Shaer|work=Film Threat|access-date=2020-01-14|language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://remezcla.com/features/film/angelfish-review-peter-andrew-lee-princess-nokia/|title=Angelfish: Film Review|work=Remezcla|access-date=2020-02-21|language=en-us}}</ref>

column1: Frasqueri identifies as [[bisexuality|bisexual]] and has stated such in a past interview
column2: they have also talked about how growing up near the [[queer]] community of New York City was an important part of their life. The early stages of their musical career began through performing at gay clubs
column3: and they gained popularity among the gay nightlife scene.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.out.com/music/2017/10/02/how-princess-nokia-achieved-gay-new-york-dream|title=How Princess Nokia Achieved the 'Gay New York Dream'|last=Moran|first=Justin|date=10 October 2017|work=[[Out (magazine)|Out]]|accessdate=28 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thelgbtsentinel.com/bi-artist-spotlight-radical-self-love-princess-nokia/|title=Bi Artist Spotlight: Radical Self Love with Princess Nokia|date=9 May 2017|work=The LGBT Sentinel|accessdate=28 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Hill |first1=Zahara |title=rincess Nokia On Being Sexually Fluid And Making Music For Girls With The 'Delusional Confidence Of Barbra Streisand' |url=https://blavity.com/princess-nokia-on-being-sexually-fluid-and-making-music-for-girls-with-the-delusional-confidence-of-barbra-streisand?category1=music&subCat=culture |website=Blavity |date=20 August 2018}}</ref>

column3: they went to live with their grandmother.<ref>{{Citation|last=Snobette|title=Princess Nokia: \"There's No Money in Record Deals & I'm Not Looking to Be Taken Advantage of\"|date=2016-07-05|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oWitkBM6gOo&t=571s|accessdate=2018-05-10}}</ref><ref name=vogue/> At the age of sixteen

column2: \"Destiny\"
column4: and released it under the name \"Wavy Spice\" on their [[SoundCloud]] page and their YouTube channel in mid-2012. It was largely autobiographical and gained modest popularity. Subsequently
column5: they released their second track
column6: \"Bitch I'm Posh\".<ref name=\"autogenerated2\" /><ref>[http://noisey.vice.com/ja/blog/wavy-spice-bitch-im-posh Wavy Spice\" \"Bitch I'm Posh\"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140220182519/http://noisey.vice.com/ja/blog/wavy-spice-bitch-im-posh |date=2014-02-20 }}</ref><ref name=\"paper\" /> The track went viral

column10: 679)]\" [[The Guardian]]. Accessed 27 November 2016</ref> Frasqueri then released ''YAYA (Yaya is a [[Taíno|Taino]] word)''<ref>{{Citation|last=Princess Nokia|title=Wavy Spice - YAYA|date=2012-10-29|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=90Y9BdyZcQc|accessdate=2018-05-10}}</ref> as a commentary of perceptions of colonial history.<ref name=\"Remezcla\">{{Cite news|url=http://remezcla.com/features/music/princess-nokia-new-age-hood-leader/|title=Princess Nokia is Our New Age Hood Leader|work=Remezcla|access-date=2017-10-05|language=en-US}}</ref>

column2: such as ''Dragons''

column5: and ''Vicki Gotti'' until changing their moniker to Princess Nokia. They released their mixtape
column7: on Soundcloud and began touring.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://soundcloud.com/princessnokiaofficial/sets/1992-deluxe|title=1992 Deluxe|website=SoundCloud|language=en|access-date=2018-01-06}}</ref>

column1: Frasqueri claims Princess Nokia is an [[alter ego]]
column2: <ref>[http://bullettmedia.com/article/wavy-spice-harlem-is-burning/ Wavy Spice: Harlem Is Burning]</ref> which they introduced with the track \"Nokia\".<ref name=\"autogenerated2\">[http://bullettmedia.com/article/hear-wavy-spice-transform-into-princess-nokia-on-nokia/ Track Premiere: Hear Wavy Spice Transform Into Princess Nokia on 'Nokia'<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> They released an album named ''Metallic Butterfly'' on May 12
column4: and was debuted on ''[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]]'' and Soundcloud.<ref>{{cite news|title=Princess Nokia's 'Metallic Butterfly'|url=https://www.vice.com/read/princess-nokias-metallic-butterfly|accessdate=5 December 2014|work=Vice|date=12 May 2014}}</ref>

column2: Frasqueri confronted a member of the audience at a charity concert at [[Cambridge University]] whom they accused of \"mouthing dirty obscenities like 'show me your tits'.\" The alleged harasser denied yelling such obscenities and told ''[[The Cambridge Student]]'': \"I was standing in the audience and was told by a fellow audience member that the name of the performer was 'Abigail'. Given that I was enjoying the performance
column3: I shouted out 'Let's go Abigail!'. After I shouted this
column4: they came down from the stage. They slapped me and threw drinks on me.\"<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.out.com/music/2017/2/22/rapper-princess-nokia-punches-audience-member-after-being-harassed-stage|title=Rapper Princess Nokia Punches Audience Member After Being Harassed On Stage|date=22 February 2017|work=[[Out (magazine)|Out]]|accessdate=23 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.tcs.cam.ac.uk/news/0036769-fashion-show-headliner-ends-set-early-after-hitting-audience-member.html|title=Fashion show headliner ends set early after hitting audience member|date=15 February 2017|work=[[The Cambridge Student]]|accessdate=23 February 2017|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170224061717/http://www.tcs.cam.ac.uk/news/0036769-fashion-show-headliner-ends-set-early-after-hitting-audience-member.html|archive-date=24 February 2017}}</ref> After returning to the stage
column5: Nokia told the crowd \"that's what you do when a White boy disrespects you\".<ref>https://heatst.com/culture-wars/rapper-princess-nokia-assaults-white-boy-in-audience-who-called-her-abigail/</ref>

column2: Frasqueri made headlines again when a viral video surfaced of them throwing hot soup in a man's face whilst on a subway journey to [[Brooklyn]].<ref name=\":0\">{{Cite news|url=https://bust.com/feminism/193616-princess-nokia-armed-with-a-fist-full-of-soup-fights-off-a-subway-racist.html|title=Princess Nokia
column3: Armed With Soup
column4: Fights Off a Subway Racist|access-date=2018-03-07|language=en-gb}}</ref> The rapper heard a white man shouting racial slurs at a group of teenagers
column5: and decided to take action against the racist remarks by slapping the man and throwing their hot soup on him.<ref name=\":0\" /> They took to [[Twitter]] saying: \"this bigot called this group of teenage boys 'n****s' on the train so I stood up and slapped him and everybody on the train backed me up\".<ref name=\":0\" />

| list_episodes        = List of Hunter Street episodes

'''''Hunter Street''''' is a [[comedy]] [[Adventure fiction|adventure]] television series created by Reint Schölvinck and Melle Runderkamp that first aired on [[Nickelodeon]] as a sneak peek on March 11
column3: before its official premiere on March 13
column5: and moved to [[TeenNick]] with the third season premiere on July 29
column6: 2019. The series stars [[Stony Blyden]]
column7: Mae Mae Renfrow
column8: Kyra Smith
column9: Thomas Jansen
column10: and Daan Creyghton as a group of five foster children who must solve a mystery in order to find their missing foster parents. Wilson Radjou-Pujalte and Kate Bensdorp join the cast in the series' second season
column11: and Eliyha Altena and [[Sarah Nauta]] join the cast in the series' third season.

column1: Five foster children in [[Amsterdam]] attempt to find out what happened to their missing foster parents.<ref name=\"World Screen\">{{cite web|url=http://worldscreen.com/tvkids/nickelodeon-preps-premiere-of-hunter-street/|title=Nickelodeon Preps Premiere of ''Hunter Street''|work=World Screen|author=Joanna Padovano Tong|date=February 24
column2: 2017|access-date=February 25
season 2; recurring
column3: season 3)<!-- Do NOT change – was not full-cast credited in the front-credits along with Smith
column4: Creyghton
column5: Bensdorp
column6: Altena and Nauta in season 3 -->

column1: The series is produced in the Netherlands<ref name=\"Het Parool\">{{cite web|url=http://www.parool.nl/kunst-en-media/nickelodeon-filmt-nieuwe-serie-de-ludwigs-in-amsterdam~a4199347/|title=Nickelodeon Filmt Nieuwe Serie De Ludwigs in Amsterdam|work=[[Het Parool]]|author=Janet Lie|language=Dutch|trans-title=Children's Series The Ludwigs Uses Historical Amsterdam as Its Decor|date=September 19
column2: 2016|access-date=March 14
column3: 2017}}</ref> by Blooming Media
column4: and was co-developed with the Nickelodeon Netherlands television series ''De Ludwigs''.<ref name=\"World Screen\" /> Nickelodeon made it known that the series' first season would contain 20 episodes on March 2
column5: 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2017/03/02/top-rated-nickelodeon-charts-path-beyond-tv-details-content-pipeline-of-almost-700-new-episodes-in-every-genre-6310/20170302nickelodeon06/|title=Top-Rated Nickelodeon Charts Path Beyond TV
column6: Details Content Pipeline of Almost 700 New Episodes in Every Genre|publisher=[[Nickelodeon]]|via=[[The Futon Critic]]|date=March 2
column7: 2017|access-date=March 3
column8: 2017}}</ref> The series was renewed for a second season of 20 episodes on April 25

| list_episodes        = List of Hunter Street episodes

'''''Hunter Street''''' is a [[comedy]] [[Adventure fiction|adventure]] television series created by Reint Schölvinck and Melle Runderkamp that first aired on [[Nickelodeon]] as a sneak peek on March 11
column3: before its official premiere on March 13
column5: and moved to [[TeenNick]] with the third season premiere on July 29
column6: 2019. The series stars [[Stony Blyden]]
column7: Mae Mae Renfrow
column8: Kyra Smith
column9: Thomas Jansen
column10: and Daan Creyghton as a group of five foster children who must solve a mystery in order to find their missing foster parents. Wilson Radjou-Pujalte and Kate Bensdorp join the cast in the series' second season
column11: and Eliyha Altena and [[Sarah Nauta]] join the cast in the series' third season.

column1: Five foster children in [[Amsterdam]] attempt to find out what happened to their missing foster parents.<ref name=\"World Screen\">{{cite web|url=http://worldscreen.com/tvkids/nickelodeon-preps-premiere-of-hunter-street/|title=Nickelodeon Preps Premiere of ''Hunter Street''|work=World Screen|author=Joanna Padovano Tong|date=February 24
column2: 2017|access-date=February 25
season 2; recurring
column3: season 3)<!-- Do NOT change – was not full-cast credited in the front-credits along with Smith
column4: Creyghton
column5: Bensdorp
column6: Altena and Nauta in season 3 -->

column1: The series is produced in the Netherlands<ref name=\"Het Parool\">{{cite web|url=http://www.parool.nl/kunst-en-media/nickelodeon-filmt-nieuwe-serie-de-ludwigs-in-amsterdam~a4199347/|title=Nickelodeon Filmt Nieuwe Serie De Ludwigs in Amsterdam|work=[[Het Parool]]|author=Janet Lie|language=Dutch|trans-title=Children's Series The Ludwigs Uses Historical Amsterdam as Its Decor|date=September 19
column2: 2016|access-date=March 14
column3: 2017}}</ref> by Blooming Media
column4: and was co-developed with the Nickelodeon Netherlands television series ''De Ludwigs''.<ref name=\"World Screen\" /> Nickelodeon made it known that the series' first season would contain 20 episodes on March 2
column5: 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thefutoncritic.com/news/2017/03/02/top-rated-nickelodeon-charts-path-beyond-tv-details-content-pipeline-of-almost-700-new-episodes-in-every-genre-6310/20170302nickelodeon06/|title=Top-Rated Nickelodeon Charts Path Beyond TV
column6: Details Content Pipeline of Almost 700 New Episodes in Every Genre|publisher=[[Nickelodeon]]|via=[[The Futon Critic]]|date=March 2
column7: 2017|access-date=March 3
column8: 2017}}</ref> The series was renewed for a second season of 20 episodes on April 25

The '''1996–97 Macedonian First League''' was the 5th season of the [[Macedonian First Football League]]
column2: the highest [[Association football|football]] league of [[North Macedonia|Macedonia]]. The first matches of the season were played on 16 August 1996 and the last on 1 June 1997.<ref name=\"First\" /> [[FK Sileks|Sileks]] defended their championship title
column3: having won their second title in a row.

column1: ; At the start of the 1996–97 season
Promoted from [[1995–96 Macedonian Second Football League|1995–96 Second League]]
Relegated to [[1996–97 Macedonian Second Football League|1996–97 Second League]]
; At the end of the 1996–97 season
Promoted from [[1996–97 Macedonian Second Football League|1996–97 Second League]]
Relegated to [[1997–98 Macedonian Second Football League|1997–98 Second League]]
